2839415379,pull_request,open,,[Backend modularization] `revisions` module,- Move all revisions-related code, including model multimethods, into the new revisions module
- Remove unused `POST /api/dashboard/:id/revert` (rework tests so they test `POST /api/revision/revert`
- Remove unused `POST /api/segment/:id/revert` (rework tests so they test `POST /api/revision/revert`)
- Have `POST /api/segment/revision/revert` support segments (the FE seemed to assume this existed -- see https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C505ZNNH4/p1738982749125859 -- but it did not)
- Remove impl of revisions for legacy metrics (it seems like the entire model should get removed, but I'll save that for another PR)

column1: 2838916136,pull_request,open,,Query builder breadcrumbs can link back to archived models,Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/52071
Enables linking back to archived models via question lineage in the query builder header
1. Create a new question based on a modal
3. go to the created question and see the model name under the question name. It should be clickable
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

column1: 2838884400,pull_request,open,,feat: Reduce cost of initial field scanning,Setting a Field `has_field_values` to `:autolist` moves from classify based on fingerprinting to the initial Field creation only based on semantic and base types.
Querying for field values and receiving too many values or too many bytes will no longer delete FieldValues or change Field `has_field_values` but rather set the `has_more_values` to true.

During sync, if a `has_field_values` is `:autolist` or `:list` but FieldValues is nil, we will not fetch a new cache of FieldValues. This way, the only way to cache new FieldValues would be by triggering an adhoc request to `GET /api/field/:id/values`.

column1: 2838719952,pull_request,closed,,docs: druid basic auth,#50905,alexyarosh,2025-02-07 17:31:28+00:00,['alexyarosh'],2025-02-07 18:08:03+00:00,2025-02-07 18:03:20+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53380,[('Type:Documentation', ''), ('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]",[],

When fetching a param's possible values, we were originally looking for concrete columns and checking result metadata. However, if the query is against a model and has an aggregation, the thing you are filtering on isn't a concrete field and probably isn't in result metadata.  Checking filterable-columns lets us find the appropriate field in that case.
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

column1: There are two parts to this fix:
1. use the transformed dataset as source of truth for tooltips: needed because it contains what the user sees

2. propagate the timezone to format the transformed data in tooltips: we feed UTC dates to echarts, which means formatting is broken if we use those dates unless we use the timezone. More generally we should never _ever_ format/parse a date without a timezone.
1. Create a line chart based on a time series with some missing data points.
2. In the chart's visualization settings, set ""Replace missing values with"" to ""Zero"".
3. Hover over the data points that should show zero in the chart.
4. Notice that the tooltip displays is all good
- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2837846309,pull_request,closed,,Log name of missing class when implicitly deleting job,Recently I had a heart attack seeing some [essential jobs get deleted](https://grafana.monitoring.metabase.com/d/Zjw_nJX7k/metabase-logs?orgId=1&var-cluster=staging-1&var-filter=Deleting%20job&var-namespace=All&var-dns_host=stats.metabase.com&var-pod=All&from=1738800000000&to=1738972799000). It turns out that their class name changed due to Clojure namespaces being moved around, and the jobs were still re-registered, but if I hadn't approved the corresponding PR this investigation may have taken some time.

I have also made this a warning so that it's more visible when doing investigations, we don't need to be worried about high volume. Well, if there is high volume we would definitely want to know about it.
(log/warnf ""Deleting job %s due to class not found (%s)""
;; WARN metabase.task :: Deleting job some.job.key due to class not found (some.missing.Class)

column1: 2836733521,pull_request,open,,Fix brush filters for longitudes that lie outside the normal -180 to 180 range,Closes #41056
Fix brush filter for `LeafletMap.jsx` to allow selecting points anywhere on the map.
1. update `Leafletmap.jsx` to call `LatLng.wrap()` to wrap longitudes in `filterBounds` into the canonical range [-180, 180].

2. modify `update-lat-lon-filter` so that if the filter bounds cross the 180th meridian, the filter is split into two parts covering the east and west sides with separate `:inside` filters that are ORed together.
Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.
3. Change viz type to Pin Map
4. Scroll east or west a long ways (far enough to cross the 180th meridian)
11. Draw a filter box that crosses the 180th meridian.
12. Unless you modify your sample DB, you won't have any points near the meridian, but if you make your box large enough you can select some points in, e.g., Alaska.
13. Verify that a two-part filter is added that covers both the eastern and western hemisphere sides of your selection.
14. Get crazy. Zoom out and select a region > 360Âº.
Loom demo posted to slack here
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

column1: 2836710464,pull_request,closed,,rename enable embedding sdk alignment migration id,# Migration ID Change
Changing migration ID from `v53.2025-01-05T00:00:01` to `v52.2025-01-05T00:00:01` to match the earliest release version where this migration appears.
- This migration needs to get backported to v52
- Per our changelog documentation, migrations should be numbered based on the lowest version they will be released in
- Having consistent IDs across versions prevents double-execution during upgrades
1. This change affects a migration that is already in master
2. Developers and staging environments may have already run this migration under the v53 ID
3. When the ID changes, Liquibase's changeset fingerprinting will see this as a completely different migration
For environments that have already run the v53 version:
- The v53 migration record will remain in their databasechangelog table
- Liquibase will run the v52 version (same content, different ID)
- This is safe because the migration is idempotent

The only reference to it in the code is in [the webpack config](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/blob/42e50fbdccb101e6bfcce99833c163ca9fe0348b/webpack.config.js#L32-L33) which isn't used by the main app",fraserdrops,2025-02-06 21:35:55+00:00,['fraserdrops'],2025-02-06 22:25:24+00:00,2025-02-06 22:25:22+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53338,"[('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]",[],

2836612168,pull_request,closed,,manual backport: reset enable-embedding-sdk,"Manual backport of https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53263 with some tricks thrown in:

This PR backports a migration that was originally merged into master with ID `v53.2025-01-05T00:00:01`. When backporting to v52, we need to carefully consider the migration ID to ensure proper behavior during upgrades.
We're changing the ID from `v53.2025-01-05T00:00:01` to `v52.2025-01-05T00:00:01` in this backport. Here's why:
1. The migration is idempotent, meaning it can safely run multiple times without side effects
2. The migration is quick to complete
3. Release branches (like release-x.52.x) don't get merged back into master
- Fresh v52 install: Will run the v52-versioned migration
- v52 -> v53 upgrade: Will run both migrations (v52 version from release branch, v53 version from master)
- No checksum violations will occur (different IDs = different changesets)
- Quick execution means minimal performance impact
- The v52 migration will remain in the databasechangelog table but won't exist in the v53 changelog files
While normally we want to avoid running the same migration twice during upgrades, in this case it's an acceptable trade-off because:
1. The migration's idempotency ensures data consistency
3. This maintains our convention of migration IDs matching their release versions
4. This is a P0 fix that can't wait for the next release

Note: For future migrations that we know will be backported, we should number them based on the lowest target version at creation time in master, per our changelog documentation.",escherize,2025-02-06 21:14:42+00:00,['escherize'],2025-02-06 22:08:52+00:00,2025-02-06 21:59:07+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53335,"[('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]","[{'comment_id': 2641154424, 'issue_id': 2836612168, 'author': 'escherize', 'body': 'closed in favor of: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53339 (which will get 2x backported)', 'created_at': datetime.datetime(2025, 2, 6, 21, 59, 42, tzinfo=datetime.timezone.utc)}, {'comment_id': 2641169318, 'issue_id': 2836612168, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': '## e2e tests failed on `30c7962340d208b5006e813d88dd57d689f079ac-1`

2836288919,pull_request,open,,[CI] Fix flaky dashboard tab test v2,### Description

My last flake fix (#53267) turned out to not be the only flake within the test. It appears there's an issue where when you go to edit the dashboard immediately after saving it can make the click on the pencil icon do nothing. Saving a dashboard has been a source of flakes in the past and we understand there's race conditions here where we can't be certain the page has settled after save. This PR adds a wait to try to avoid issue, but it certainly isn't an ideal fix.

This passes with [a 50 run stress test](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/13185476197/job/36806422201) but my last ""fix"" also passed stress testing, so I'm unsure how much value we can place in this.

I tried running the whole `e2e/test/scenarios/dashboard/dashboard.cy.spec.js` spec 10x, but it failed / ran out of memory. This leads me to believe that my test failing has more to do with constrained resources rather than any issue with the test itself. https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/13185459816/job/36806370629

Here are all the supported types that will be shown in the changelog:
- `feat`
- `fix`
- `perf`

These types `docs`, `style`, `refactor`, `test`, `build`, and `ci` are also encouraged for non-changelog related tasks.

Please also make sure to include `sdk` scope, otherwise, the changelog will not include this task.

2835641390,pull_request,closed,,Fix search for queries with single backslashes,Fixes queries like this one: https://grafana.monitoring.metabase.com/d/Zjw_nJX7k/metabase-logs?orgId=1&var-cluster=metabase-1&var-filter=api%2Fsearch&var-namespace=All&var-dns_host=All&var-pod=All&from=1738796478000&to=1738811065000
We rely on quoting in our `tsquery` to handle special characters, but backslashes need special treatment as they can also escape quotes.

Our current dictionary strips out backslashes, and we let users escape their own quotes in the raw query, so there's no real reason to keep them, but this approach is more future-proof than simply removing them.",crisptrutski,2025-02-06 14:08:27+00:00,['crisptrutski'],2025-02-07 11:32:43+00:00,2025-02-07 10:50:54+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53296,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]","[{'comment_id': 2640141852, 'issue_id': 2835641390, 'author': 'trunk-io[bot]', 'body': '<!-- Trunk Test Analytics -->

2834889149,pull_request,closed,,fix(sdk): Fix question not found error showing briefly after navigating from dashboards,[EMB-48](https://linear.app/metabase/issue/EMB-84/interactivedashboard-briefly-shows-question-not-found-after-drilling)

The code resolves around https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/49714. I wasn't taking into account when navigating to interactive question's sub components from outside itself. In this case, the problem arises when we navigate to interactive questions from `EditableDashboard` or `InteractiveDashboard` and only when there is a filter value mapped to a question card, that's when we'll open a new question as an ad-hoc question. The fix is to add logic to support these 2 additional use cases.
- Run storybook with `yarn storybook-embedding-sdk`, and visit
- you might need to modify the JWT secret in `enterprise/frontend/src/embedding-sdk/test/CommonSdkStoryWrapper.tsx` first.

- Drill through from those 2 components and see that there's no `Question not found` error briefly showing anymore. You can revert the change (1 line) to see that the problem should exhibit for both components
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

column1: - Add a real `.core` namespace to the legacy MBQL module

- Rename the schemas from `:metabase.legacy-mbql.schema/Whatever` to `:legacy-mbql/whatever` so we can feel comfortable about using them without requiring the schema namespace directly (it is now loaded indirectly on launch by `.init`)
- Have `defclause` macros generate `:legacy-mbql.clause/whatever` schemas so we can refer to them by keyword instead of by var

- Update custom Kondo hook for `defclause` so jump-to-definition works for legacy MBQL clause schema keywords",camsaul,2025-02-06 00:54:20+00:00,['camsaul'],2025-02-07 22:17:32+00:00,,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53280,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DevEx', '')]","[{'comment_id': 2638389509, 'issue_id': 2834255737, 'author': 'trunk-io[bot]', 'body': '<!-- Trunk Test Analytics -->

column1: 2834035853,pull_request,closed,,[CI] Fix flaky dashboard test,This PR fixes a race condition for the dashboard tabs PR I just added in #53204. Here's 20x run of the test to prove it works: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/13167590409/job/36751312115

When working on a refactor of the tests I had moved `H.openQuestionsSidebar()` calls into `assertPreventLeave` but this last usage went unnoticed and was actually making tests pass locally due to a timing issue where the first click on the `+` button was going unregistered. I've added an assert that the tabs have been correctly reordered in the UI which makes the test a bit more robust and causes cypress to wait for the UI to catch up to the result of the drag.

This test is also failing in the original PR's backport #53254. I'll cherry pick the changes from this PR into that backport once this is approved.",sloansparger,2025-02-05 21:54:08+00:00,['sloansparger'],2025-02-05 23:16:34+00:00,2025-02-05 22:24:22+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53267,"[('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/AdminWebapp', 'Admin and Webapp team')]","[{'comment_id': 2638210352, 'issue_id': 2834035853, 'author': 'trunk-io[bot]', 'body': '<!-- Trunk Test Analytics -->

Stores a hashed version of the session-id in the database rather than the plain version to improve security.

**NOTE**: To support upgrade without logging out existing users, the hashed keys will be stored in a new `core_session.key_hashed` column rather than continuing to use the `core_session.id` column. This allows us to continue to check the core_session.id column plain-text (IF AND NOLY IF the session cookie is a UUID) for legacy sessions and hashed_key for the hashed version. New records generate a random id string for the id value.
Making the `core_session.id` be a random value also allows us to have foreign keys to the session without including even the hashed key value in other tables, further improving security.
**NOTE:** If anyone downgrades to a version prior to this change, the existing sessions will become invalid because of the `id` checked by old versions will no longer have the session ids in them.
Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.
1. Log into the app and check that the core_session table does not contain a UUID-formatted id in either the id or key_hashed column.

2833626455,pull_request,closed,,One parent test job + run it on draft PRs,Instead of littering testing conditionals around 4 separate testing workflows, what if we just calculated them once?
Now, PRs call one parent test job that checks which files changed and conditionally calls the other testing workflows:
â­  Bonus: you can see all test job results on one results page
â¤ï¸  Bonus: you can re-run all flaky jobs in all workflows with one click
Also, by popular demand, all tests run on draft PRs now.

Sessions older than `max-session-age` cannot be used for authentication, but if users do not explicitly log out they linger in the `core_session` table.
This PR adds a daily quartz task to delete any sessions older than `max-session-age`

NOTE: sessions older than `max-session-age` could never be used for authentication previously due to the query in `metabase/server/middleware/session.clj:103` used to check the session-id. So this is just removing rows that would never be selected anyway.
Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.
1. Have a database with `core_session` rows older than `max-session-age`
2. Wait for the job to trigger (2am) or manually run it
3. See that the old sessions are deleted
- [X] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

column1: 2833282988,pull_request,closed,,remove all instances of describeEE, onlyOnEE and onlyOnOSS","Closes https://linear.app/metabase/issue/DEV-22/remove-describeee-and-onlyonoss-blocks

Removes pesky describeEE, onlyOnOss and onlyOnEE helpers. after some talks with @iethree, we concluded that `describeEE`Â blocks only add noise to the repo. Tests are ran on enterprise by default, and oss tests ar ran by using `@oss` grep tag.  this renders `onlyOnOss` pretty much useless, with the exception of running locally.

to avoid confusion when running locally, I added a helper to `cypresss/support/cypress.js` file that will automatically skip all the `@oss` tagged tests when in interactive mode with instructions on how to run these tests.

hopefully Iâ€™m not forgetting anything, but the logic seems to be exactly the same as before, unless thereâ€™s some black swan Iâ€™m unaware of.",filiphric,2025-02-05 15:33:13+00:00,['filiphric'],2025-02-07 16:50:09+00:00,2025-02-07 08:27:02+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53240,"[('.CI & Tests', ''), ('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]","[{'comment_id': 2637401298, 'issue_id': 2833282988, 'author': 'trunk-io[bot]', 'body': '<!-- Trunk Test Analytics -->

column1: 2833138445,pull_request,closed,,Fix search index update job restart issue,This fixes the issue where the job throws an exception and is never restarted.

It hopefully also fixed the less deterministic issue where some pods don't start the job and others do, which I think has to do with the job being durable and having triggers get deleted and recreated.
This needs to be backported all the way to v52.

Closes ENG-14668",crisptrutski,2025-02-05 14:40:33+00:00,['crisptrutski'],2025-02-05 16:30:16+00:00,2025-02-05 15:40:51+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53229,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]","[{'comment_id': 2637221793, 'issue_id': 2833138445, 'author': 'trunk-io[bot]', 'body': '<!-- Trunk Test Analytics -->

column1: 2833106010,pull_request,closed,,add estimated size to Search Results virtual list in entity picker,Closes ENG 8233
Adds an accurate estimated size for a `<ChunkyListItem>` in the search tab, which solves the issue of of weird scrolling
1. Open an entity picker (data picker is a good choice)
2. Perform a search that will return many results
3. grab the scroll bar in the search results, and drag down. the bar should follow your mouse
- ~[ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR~

There was a reference in the original issue that points to a test that can be changed once this is fixed. However, that test has since changed, and doing a simple `scrollTo(""bottom"")` still results in weird behavior. I've confirmed the UX is better for real users, but cypress interactions still appear to be fussy

column1: 2832697842,pull_request,closed,,allow draft prs with label to run tests,This PR implements [this RFC](https://www.notion.so/metabase/111-Allow-tests-to-run-on-draft-PRs-with-a-label-11a69354c90180b0b2d9c66b33ff3ba9).
We'd want draft PR in addition to ready-for-review PRs to run tests, but only when there is a label `run-tests` in the PR.
There are a lot of skipped checks.
The number of skipped checks is comparable to the ready-for-review one. They're totally equal because the screenshot is captured at different stages and with different runners picking up the checks.
This makes sure that normal ready-for-review PRs would have tests run as usual, like this PR in the current state.

column1: 2832520139,pull_request,closed,,fix(sdk): remove unsafe lifecycle errors from DashboardGrid,Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/48497, ENG-8667
This PR combined with https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/52885 will close the above issue, but 52885 is more likely to get merged before this one
Removes the unsafe React lifecycle from the `<DashboardGrid />` component, which was causing console errors:
- Using UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps in strict mode is not recommended and may indicate bugs in your code
It does this by replacing `UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps` with `static getDerivedStateFromProps`, refer to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/52885 for how that works
- Run the SDK and render a InteractiveDashboard (which should render a DashboardGrid)
- The UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps should still be there, but come from other components (e.g. Table, TableInteractive, Link from react-router 3)
- Add a dummy UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps to DashboardGrid.jsx
- The SDK end-to-end test now errors due to unsafe lifecycle being in Visualization

column1: 2831669169,pull_request,closed,,[Dashboards] Mark dashboard as dirty if tabs are edited,Related to ENG-14565

A recent internal bug report had some odd experiences around editing a dashboard. Initially this was believed to be related to the recent cards in dashboards changes, but really these were bugs that existed already but users were more likely to encounter now that we actively encourage them to leave a dashboard during the edit flow.

**This PR makes it so that adding, moving, removing, renaming, and duplicating a tab marks the dashboard as dirty.** While users are able to save tab only changes, they wouldn't be prevented from leaving the dashboard or asked to save their changes as if they had made an edit to card. You can see the bug here:
- adds e2e coverage for leaving a dashboard if cards are edited
- adds a missing key prop to a component I noticed react was warning about in the console
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

column1: I haven't created a full copy of the `query-metric` tool, so I'm not using the fully recursive snake_case <-> kebab-case conversion yet. As long as we want to keep the original tool interface functional, I prefer to do the conversion only at the level required by the ai-service.
The query-metric tool can be invoked like this:
-H 'Cookie: metabase.SESSION=<session ID used by the FE>' \

The `arguments` object should correspond to the JSON schema of the query-metric tool, `session_id` should be the session ID used by the FE and is passed around so that we can correlate the different pieces of a conversation.
The response (formatted for readability) then looks like this:
""description"": ""The date and time an order was submitted.""

`structured_output` is used instead of just `output` to make it clear that the output is not just plain text (like and error message or status, for example). In there, the `type` and `query` fields are not for the agent, they are used to store the state. The `query` object inside `query` is MBQL and has camel-case fields as explained above. `query_id` and `result_columns` are as specified by the JSON schema of the query-metric tool.

The `session_id` from the request is returned in the response too.",metamben,2025-02-04 19:15:16+00:00,['metamben'],2025-02-05 14:40:04+00:00,2025-02-05 14:40:01+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53195,"[('Metabot/Tools', 'Tools that are agnostic of the LLM framework itself, could be reused for notifications framework als')]","[{'comment_id': 2634877814, 'issue_id': 2831090332, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': ""## e2e tests failed on `562c99e774926d59957752de6ec03db1efc67ad1-2`

column1: > For those employed by Metabase: if you are merging into master, please add either a `backport` or a `no-backport` label to this PR. You will not be able to merge until you do this step. Refer to the section [Do I need to backport this PR?](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Metabase-Branching-Strategy-6eb577d5f61142aa960a626d6bbdfeb3?pvs=4#89f80d6f17714a0198aeb66c0efd1b71) in the Metabase Branching Strategy document for more details. If you're not employed by Metabase, this section does not apply to you, and the label will be taken care of by your reviewer.

> If that is your first contribution to Metabase, please sign the [Contributor License Agreement](https://docs.google.com/a/metabase.com/forms/d/1oV38o7b9ONFSwuzwmERRMi9SYrhYeOrkbmNaq9pOJ_E/viewform) (unless it's a tiny documentation change). Also, if you're attempting to fix a translation issue, please submit your changes to our [POEditor project](https://poeditor.com/join/project/ynjQmwSsGh) instead of opening a PR.

2830998603,pull_request,closed,,"ðŸ¤– backported ""fix(sdk): echarts tooltip is cut off below the viewport height""","#52822

> This is a second backport attempt for https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/52310 as it was reverted due to it causing a P1 issue https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/52732. The P1 was caused by 1) the automatically backported PR referencing a CSS variable that does not exist yet which relies on https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/49442 (not backported), and 2) the e2e changes for custom fixed-position visibility checks does not assert the resulting z-index. See [postmortem](https://www.notion.so/metabase/Echarts-tooltip-in-a-dashboard-is-hidden-behind-charts-18869354c9018094a5efe812c3a8228b?pvs=4) for more info.

This PR backports the `--mb-overlay-z-index` CSS variable (originally added by Raffi on the stacking context PR) to Metabase 52 by using the CSS variable mapping. It does this by adding the `popover: {zIndex: DEFAULT_Z_INDEX}}` defaults. Note that we are using ""4"" (the current default in 52) instead of ""200"" (the default in 53) to avoid breaking other things.

2830735595,pull_request,closed,,Mark browse metrics flakes as flaky,related to DEVX-130

Marking these tests as flaky. The flake is intermittent, and is related to async search indexing. Some percentage of the time, the search index has just not caught up with newly created metrics and can't find any metrics in these tests.

2830450455,pull_request,closed,,disable video recording on snapshots and delete videos on success,### Description

I noticed that we compress videos even after successful specs. this is because our previous implementation of deleting videos would not delete videos if a test retried (using Cypress config.retries). This adds a ton of time, because every spec has that ""compressing video"" step happening. Since we donâ€™t save artifacts of tests that flaked only of those that ultimately failed, there is no point of doing this compression.
Also, it seems like we have video enabled for snapshots creating, which as far as I know, nobody needs.
Hopefully some tests in the flaky category fail, so that we can see that videos are still being recorded, but I tested this locally and it works the way it should.
**EDIT:** Looks like I may have done some error, tests are still being recorded, so Iâ€™ll need to fix them

**EDIT2:** I needed to move the ""after:spec"" hook because as it turns out, it wasnâ€™t getting triggered at all. everything should now be working as intended and we are shaving off some more seconds from the test run",filiphric,2025-02-04 14:34:57+00:00,['filiphric'],2025-02-05 14:40:39+00:00,2025-02-05 13:57:12+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53169,"[('.CI & Tests', ''), ('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]","[{'comment_id': 2634301744, 'issue_id': 2830450455, 'author': 'trunk-io[bot]', 'body': '<!-- Trunk Test Analytics -->

column1: 2830397198,pull_request,closed,,Dashcard titles no longer interactive when editing the dashboard,Closes #47228
The dashcard title should not look interactive when the dashboard is being edited.
Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.
1. Create a question (any) and add it to a new dashboard
3. Add a filter and click to edit it
5. The title should not look like a link, and clicking on it should do nothing
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

column1: 2830379671,pull_request,closed,,fixed logo to support opacity and color props. looks correct in adminâ€¦,### Description

Last week the Logo Icon was updated with a new SVG. However, it didn't react the way we wanted in stats, where we set the color to white (instead of `brand`). This change removes the color props and adds `opacity=""0.2""` to the lighter color dots. I also checked that this looks correct in OSS as well, where it looks like we use a different component for rendering logos
1. Go to the homepage and see our Icon in all it's glory
2. Go to the admin app. The icon should still look lovely, but be white and shades of purple

column1: 2830007320,pull_request,closed,,ensure that the link abstracted from element is not empty,Closes https://linear.app/metabase-inc/issue/ENG-14666/dashboard-questions-admin-can-share-a-dashboard-card-via-public-link

Test started flaking out because it could not find the right element. The reason why it could not be found is that the test ended on login screen. The reason for ending up on login screen was that the test was trying to open invalid URL. This URL was obtained from an element that would take a little while to load its value. If the test ran too early, it would copy an empty value, end up opening invalid link, ending up on login screen and not finding the right element
Before entering `.then()` block, we need to make sure that the copied link value is not empty:

column1: 2829937821,pull_request,open,,Fix the code blocks in README.md to facilitate the copy feature,I removed the `$` button and added the syntax declaration for the code block so the copy button will not copy the `$` symbol which causes errors when the users run the command in shell.
When the users ran the command with a `$` symbol, the shell did not recognize the command so the copy button of the code block was useless.
Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.
3. Click on the copy button to copy the command.
4. Paste it directly into the shell and it works fine.

2829850419,pull_request,open,,feat: use liquibase session lock instead of transaction lock,"Prevent the migration lock class of errors in non-h2 dbs by using a liquibase session lock instead of a transaction lock.
This type of lock would clear automatically when the connection closes for any reason.
Using this approach there is no need for the metabase release lock command except with h2.
The force migration command still is applicable though, as it does more things than just release the lock.

column1: filipesilva (Issue Creator) on (2025-02-07 10:13:56 UTC): @crisptrutski this is not correct: the session lock is always released if the initiating process is terminated. That is the case that https://github.com/blagerweij/liquibase-sessionlock covers.

Converts postgres arrays to vectors so that nippy doesn't break trying to serialize.
Note: Not sure if an http request was the best way to test this but it was the quickest way I was able to. Let me know if there's a better way to write the test.
See repro steps in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/53083, the issue should no longer occur.
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

column1: 2828420808,pull_request,closed,,Fix quick filter drill for trend charts,Closes #46168

The `clicked` object returned by `getCurrentMetricData` had the `value` from the aggregation cell, but the `column` from the date dimension, which breaks the quick filter drill (and probably others).
Instead, return the `column` that corresponds to the aggregation `value`.
1. Create a GUI question ""Count of Orders by Created At""
4. Select one of the ""Filter by this value"" operators (e.g. `>`)
Should add the appropriate filter and display the results.
- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2828199993,pull_request,closed,,[Dashboards] Prevent duplicate edit dashboard calls from breaking dashboard save,### Description
Currently edits to a dashboard can be lost in a very particular set of steps:
1. the user makes edits to a dashboard
2. the user creates a new tab
3. the user hits the empty state's ""Add a chart"" button
4. the user then creates a ""New question"" or ""New sql question"" from the sidebar

This bug is in part a result of #52639, which introduce a new empty state to dashboards. The offending function is `handleAddQuestion` in `frontend/src/metabase/dashboard/components/Dashboard/Dashboard.tsx`, which makes a call to `setEditingDashboard` with the current dashboard. If the user is in the edit state, this button sets the current edit dashboard state to the currently edited/dirty dashboard. This has downstream effects when the user goes to save, if the user hasn't made any changes since the last call to this function. Our `updateDashboardAndCards` function will skip submitting our dashboard edits to the server as it diffs that there were no changes before and after editing.
Ultimately the above mistake would be easy for anyone to accidentally make. In this PR, I do 3 things to fix this now and for future engineers:

1. Fix the improper call to `setEditingDashboard` if we're already in an edit state on the dashboard. In `Dashboard.tsx` I colocate the setting the edit state and make sure it only happens if we're currently not in the edit state.

2. Warn developers if they're setting the editing dashboard to a dashboard with the same id. Since the repro steps are quite specific in this case I wanted to avoid throwing an error. It seems likely developers would be able to create other edge cases similar to this in the future that we can't possibly predict. If we throw we'd be relying on users to report when they're noticing thrown errors (and praying that they submitted a decent set of steps to repro).

3. Continue to the use the old editing dashboard state when a dashboard with the same id is dispatched. Currently this is all we ever want the logic to be. I think in some future case where it's not what we want, it will be obvious to a developer that something is wrong before shipping a feature, which again I think makes this a better approach than throwing an error.
Fix Demo (note: save to tab doesn't currently work, so it's expected new card is saved to tab 1)

column1: 2828111880,pull_request,closed,,Check circular dependencies for cards on save/run,Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/35980
The issue is that we can save cards with circular dependencies.
The simple case is question A joins with question A. You can save it, bad things happen when you try to load it again.
The harder case is when question A joins with B, B joins with C, and C joins with A. Same bad stuff happens.
I've added logic to `Lib.canRun` to check for cycles. We shouldn't be running such circular questions anyway (they're not useful).

If the frontend has metadata for A, B, and C, it can detect the cycle and prevents running, previewing, and saving on the frontend. If it doesn't have the metadata, there's not much to do. Running and previewing may still work.

The backend has the metadata, and so can detect the cycles easily and prevent the cycle. It returns a 400 error for the put to /api/card/:id. The payload of the response is 'Card of type question is invalid, cannot be saved.'
Unfortunately, the frontend does not pick up on this. It seems the reducers are not handling 400 errors correctly.
3. Save the question. Call it A.
4. Add join to A order.id = A.id.
5. Note that you cannot save nor preview.
3. Save the question. call it A.
9. add join to B. Notice you cannot save or preview (good!)
11. Add join to B. Notice you can save.
14. Reload to notice A was not saved (still just has orders table, no join).

column1: ericnormand (Issue Creator) on (2025-02-07 15:14:17 UTC): I started this over in a new branch: #53373
2828100795,pull_request,closed,,Allow private slack channels to be returned for alerts/subscriptions,Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/44798

Users can now send notifications to private channels. With the caveat that existing connections to slack will need to be granted an additional oauth scope, for which I've provided guidance in the docs here: [docs/configuring-metabase/slack.md](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53128/files#diff-e0ce4eb74e73749598c8abd003d02aafa2873d7917a120e54767c96dc3f3a6d5R87).
Makes it possible for the `conversation.list` call to request private channels, which are then used to populate the drop down box when selecting a channel for an alert.
The `groups:read` oauth scope is needed to list private channels.
- New slack installations will get this by default, as we have added the scope to the `manifest.yaml`.
- Existing installations can be reinstalled with the scope (in slack app settings), metabase will then start to request private channels, once the conversations cache is cleared (10mins TTL)
- Installations that do not have the required scope work as before, they do not request private channels.
> **note** the image channel must still be public, otherwise the previews do not appear correctly in slack. Will raise a new issue, as this seems surprising
Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.
1. Create a slack workspace or use the metabase workspace
3. Add the slack integration (admin settings -> notification channels -> slack)
4. Invite the slack app to your new private channel
7. The slack channel list should also list private channels the slack bot has been invited to
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

column1: 2827863097,pull_request,open,,Reset title to default now reflects reality,Closes #52769
The ChartSettingInput (a controlled TextInput, really) would not updated its internal staten when the prop value changed. This is now fixed.
1. Add a line chart to a dashboard
2. Customize the line color and chart title in dashboard level viz settings and save
3. Go back into dashboard edit mode and reset the viz settings for the card
4. Note that the preview shows the chart itself reverted to the Question level settings, and the Title has also been reverted
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2827642001,pull_request,open,,fixes offset images when dnd-ing columns in dashcards,Closes #52905

This bug only happens when dragging around columns for a pivot table _within_ a dashcard, because react-beautiful-dnd (which is the lib we use to handle drag-and-drop) gets confused by the portalled dialog, basically. They recommend to use a cloning approach and the Droppable component even exposes the right prop to do so.

Incidentally, this revealed that the Pivot table doesn't refresh when the columns are being reordered. In prod, no error lmessages is logged in the console but in dev, we can see that there's a maximum call stack error happening. I fixed this too, for good measure.
Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.
1. Edit a dashboard with a pivot table
2. Bring up visualization options for the pivot
4. The dragged item should follow the mouse cursor nicely
- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

column1: 2827337037,pull_request,closed,,fix(sdk): fixes `NotFoundError: Failed to execute 'removeChild' on 'Node'` on nextjs app router when a TableInteractive component is rendered,Fixes: https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/51628
When a TableInteractive is rendered on a nextjs **app** router app via the sdk, it breaks.
I tried to figure out why this issue is only showing up on that specific scenario (it wasn't  showing up on pages router) but I wasn't lucky in that.
I was able to locate the issue to the `unmountRoot` call inside `onMeasureHeaderRender`:
I tried a few things to fix it but ultimately the best thing was to just renamed the method from `UNSAFE_componentWillMount` to `componentDidMount`.
I didn't notice any delay/layout shifting compared to before the change
Core app: this should not affect anything. I tried to play around with it and I didn't see anything weird but I may have missed some performance detail.

SDK: This should have broken with both StaticQuestion or InteractiveQuestion, if they rendered a TableInteractive component, try to render one and it should not be broken now.",npretto,2025-02-03 12:12:01+00:00,['npretto'],2025-02-05 14:37:50+00:00,2025-02-05 14:36:15+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53107,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Embedding', '')]","[{'comment_id': 2630802890, 'issue_id': 2827337037, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': ""## e2e tests failed on `5cfecfc07a9dae84f2c97194782dd2c6b6156c8c-3`

column1: npretto (Issue Creator) on (2025-02-05 14:37:48 UTC): @metabase-bot backport release-x.52.x

The flakiness seemed to have happened mostly because of some sort of caching when switching between different views. When a metric was deleted and then restored, there seemed to have been a short time period that during which the data was not updated. This also seemed to contribute to all the other tests.
I added guard assertions for an API call and empty state (when restoring) so that the test does not proceed sooner than it should

As our e2e test suite has grown in size and complexity, we ended up with a rats nest of configuration options that You Just Had To Know About in order to make many e2e tests work. This tries to simplify and unify those options, while preserving the ability to customize as much as you want.

column2: with this
test-cypress

column1: The single script now has a number of configurable options, with sensible defaults, with a bias for things ""just working"" out of the box
// if you want to change these, set them as environment variables in your shell

column2: component
oss

column1: Some other enhancements have been made like:
- yelling at you if you're trying to run EE tests without an enterprise token
- reminding you to start your frontend
- throwing an error if you already have a backend running
- [x] can run with a custom backend

One thing I noticed though is that sometimes it doesn't seem to find the test files, it happened a few times in my limited testing, not sure if it's related to the changes in this or if it was already an issue/it's my local cypress. Refreshing the page seems to make it work

2824558679,pull_request,closed,,Dont run redshift upload tests on PRs,Our redshift test infrastructure is getting overloaded for reasons that we don't fully understand yet. For now, let's only run the heaviest tests (the upload tests) on master and release branches.

2824463807,pull_request,open,,Limit last-id queries in SQL to improve performance,"### Description
In #48674 it was noted that the query `select * from permission_revision order by id` is always > 1s on their dataset due to it's size.

The query appear to be coming from the `latest-id` function which just needs the 1st element and only the id, not other fields which can be large. I don't have a large enough database to verify the speed difference, but querying only for the id we need rather than including potentially large columns + not letting it know we only need one record should improve the performance.
1. With a database with a large history of permission revisions, track the query speed of `SELECT MAX(""id"") AS ""id"" FROM ""permissions_revision""` which is now the query.
- [X] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2824431671,pull_request,closed,,Don't infer join aliases when replacing a join,"Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/37039

When replacing a join, we were taking a valid join (with a correctly set up join alias), dropping the alias, creating a new alias, and then inferring which fields belonged to the new alias.  This caused issues when joining models using a field that could plausibly belong to either model, because we inferred that the lhs join condition belonged to the rhs model.  This in turn confused the join naming code and caused us to refer to the lhs as ""previous results"" instead of the correct table name.

With the new code, if we want to rename the new join, we explicitly replace the old alias with the new alias instead of just removing the new alias and inferring what goes with what.  This avoids potentially incorrect inferences and fixes this issue (and possibly others?).
2. Make a question that joins the two models
3. Swap the condition lhs to be a field that is present in both models (created_at, id, etc)
4. Verify that it continues to call the lhs model by the correct name
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

column1: This PR implements the Upsell for the advanced permissions on both (1) `/admin/performance/databases` and (2) `/admin/performance/groups` routes. This component leverages the recently introduced Upsell Banner whose horizontal layout pairs nicely with the permissions pages. See the demo below.
More importantly, this PR also removes a lot of (now) obsolete, custom upsell code. Namely, the code around `ToolbarUpsell` component.
> Even though @iethree suggested to use the upsell even on the empty state page, the product said no (cc @trinya ).
> tl;dr We're only showing the upsell to admins when they are actively managing permissions.

2824358248,pull_request,open,,[refs] Add `entity_id` columns to databases, tables, fields","Closes #53048.
These three entities have previously used their names as their serdes
keys. The names are still used for serdes but we want opaque, stable
`entity_id`s as well so that they can be used as `:ident`s in the field
refs overhaul. Then the name of a database, schema, table or field can
be changed without its `:ident` changing, and therefore without breaking
The internal audit DB (EE feature) uses hardcoded `entity_id`s, since
it gets checked into git and the `entity_id`s need to be stable.
Databases, tables and fields have `entity_id`s now. They aren't necessarily
returned from API calls or `MetadataProvider`s yet; that will come in later PRs.
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
- New test: loading a fresh audit DB
- New test: backfilling a pre-existing audit DB without `entity_id`s at startup

column1: This email started going out in 50 as a one-time task that runs whenever an instance starts up, as a reminder to migrate legacy permission settings to new values. Recently it seems to be firing more than expected when customers upgrade to 52.8, maybe having something to do with inactive tables with legacy permission settings.

But regardless, we can just delete this email now. ([Slack](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C052ZBWRG3W/p1738352252137559?thread_ts=1738346474.365799&cid=C052ZBWRG3W) for context)",noahmoss,2025-01-31 19:40:27+00:00,['noahmoss'],2025-01-31 21:16:04+00:00,2025-01-31 20:16:15+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53061,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]","[{'comment_id': 2628233949, 'issue_id': 2824261786, 'author': 'noahmoss', 'body': '* **#53061** ðŸ‘ˆ (View in Graphite) * `master`

2824069792,pull_request,open,,Fix ""decimals"" viz setting ignored when formatting numbers","Fixes #25791

The `decimals` viz setting was ignored when formatting compact numbers. As a result, if I had a scalar card returning a value like ""500,000"" with `decimals: 0`, in ""compact"" mode, it'd be displayed as ""500,0k"" instead of ""500k""
2. Set the viz type to ""Scalar"" and set ""Number of decimal places"" to 0 in viz settings sidebar
3. Save the question and add it to a dashboard
4. Resize the dashcard to the smallest possible size

5. Ensure it's displayed as ""500k"" instead of ""500,0k""",kulyk,2025-01-31 17:44:04+00:00,['kulyk'],2025-01-31 20:41:58+00:00,,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53053,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DashViz', 'Dashboard and Viz team')]","[{'comment_id': 2627987156, 'issue_id': 2824069792, 'author': 'github-actions[bot]', 'body': ""## e2e tests failed on `89752871b1daf13c5d272b2176af710d08a5d882-2`

column1: 2822497198,pull_request,open,,Leverage LSP to make sure things that could be private are private,This is another one of those rules that keeps the codebase sane and the cognitive load down that our team is generally good about but rule breakages still slip thru the cracks occasionally... add a test that will find vars that should be marked `:private`:
This var is only used in the namespace it is declared in. Make it private, so
Kondo can detect if it is unused, and so we have an easier time refactoring it
in the future (it's a lot easier to change something if you know it's not used
It also makes it easier for someone using this namespace to know what the
intended 'public API' of it is. You can always make private things public later
For vars that are used in test namespaces, but not in normal source code, you can
refer to private vars like #'this -- please do that. Don't make things public
just for the sake of tests.
We have over 1000 places that break the rules, so I'll have to go in and fix a massive amount of naughty code... I'll also need to come up with some sort of escape hatch.

column1: 2822292522,pull_request,closed,,CI driver job tweaks,This is an attempt to make Redshift a little more stable by taking the load off of it a bit and having failing job runs fail quicker.

- Reduce Redshift timeout from 90 to 60 minutes. If it completes successfully, it does so in 10-30 minutes; if it starts taking longer than that's usually caught in 100% CPU land and will fail anyway.

- By that logic I've also lowered the timeout for all other drivers to 60 minutes, and SQL Server to 30 --  SQL Server usually finishes in ~6 minutes but I've seen it randomly hang for the entire 90 minutes before. It would have been quicker to kill and retry it.

- Make Redshift jobs fail right away as soon as the first test fails -- if we get into 100% CPU based test failures this will start start reducing the load right away instead of letting several jobs thrash. This will also let us retry a little sooner.",camsaul,2025-01-31 02:24:42+00:00,['camsaul'],2025-02-06 23:05:12+00:00,2025-01-31 02:51:59+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/53015,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DevEx', '')]","[{'comment_id': 2626218689, 'issue_id': 2822292522, 'author': 'trunk-io[bot]', 'body': '<!-- Trunk Test Analytics -->

column1: 2822280473,pull_request,closed,,fix invalid pivot table columns in click behavior,Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/52339

The click behavior column mapping used `results_metadata.columns` to understand which columns of a dashcard can be mapped to the source. However, for pivot tables, it contains completely invalid set of columns due to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/41896.
This PR makes mapping logic use dataset columns.
Follow repro steps from the original issue.
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

column1: 2821906259,pull_request,closed,,Elide data in task_history.details which can get very large,Closes #52748
Elides the json data stored in `task_history.details` which can grow to the point that it makes backups difficult.
Using the `sync-all-indexes!` hijack in the linked issue with an error with 100k parameters, the size of the `details` column went from 18,607,482 to 13,284 chars.
The elided data looks like this:
""message"": ""PreparedStatement can have at most 65,535 parameters. Please consider using arrays, or splitting the query in several ones, or using COPY. Given query has 300,002 parameters"",
- [X] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

- Cleans up some casing (e.g., entity id -> Entity ID).",jeff-bruemmer,2025-01-30 20:27:16+00:00,['jeff-bruemmer'],2025-02-07 17:43:06+00:00,,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/52992,"[('Type:Documentation', ''), ('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge')]",[],
2821712152,pull_request,closed,,Port native queries to MBQL lib,"Use MBQL lib under the hood for `NativeQuery` class. Mostly worked out of the box, but:
- `templateTags`  and `withTemplateTags` didn't have JS<->CLJS conversion implemented
- `withTemplateTags` had deep merge, preventing removing any properties from existing template tags

- reordering of template tags cannot be ported to MBQL lib because of caching issues, as in clojure maps with the same keys in different order are equal. We should probably refactor the FE to rely on the order of `parameters` instead.
In the future we should aim to get rid of `NativeQuery` class altogether.
- Creating native questions via the native query editor should work

- It should be possible to use template tags of all different types. Pay special attention to changing template tag properties.",ranquild,2025-01-30 20:05:24+00:00,['ranquild'],2025-01-31 14:46:36+00:00,2025-01-31 14:46:33+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/52991,"[('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch'), ('.Team/Querying', '')]","[{'comment_id': 2625584768, 'issue_id': 2821712152, 'author': 'trunk-io[bot]', 'body': '<!-- Trunk Test Analytics -->

column1: 2821708982,pull_request,closed,,Ensure the classloader is in task thread contexts,This should ensure one-off tasks will find classes in our plugin system. The issue arose when `submit-task!` was called to sync an unhidden bigquery table before any query was run on the main thread before hand.
This ensures that if either of these tasks runs before classloader has been set, that their threads will inherit it.
Testing this from source is not possible right away since the classloaders behave so differently between jars and sources.

2821462759,pull_request,closed,,Fix parameter popover width when the datepicker changes its width,Fixes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/52918

The problem is that `usePopover` sets `maxWidth` on the popover dropdown to prevent overflow, which causes issues when the dropdown size changes. It's not possible to configure middlewares with mantine v6, but with mantine v7 we could set different `size` middleware options.
- Add a date parameter to a dashboard
- Change its default value. Click on the default value picker, then `Specific dates`. The popover should be repositioned to stay inside the window without overflow.

2821295538,pull_request,closed,,Support not specifying is_group_manager in /api/user calls on Pro,Closes #46671
When going from OSS to Pro, API calls to PUT `api/user/ID` with `user_group_memberships` needed to have `is_group_manager` set.
This PR defaults the `is_group_manager` value to ""false"" unless the user already was a member of that group, in which case it keeps the same `is_group_manager` value.
Describe the steps to verify that the changes are working as expected.
- [X] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

column1: 2821100195,pull_request,open,,fix: Bar chart data labels jump 1px on hover. close #48846,Closes https://github.com/metabase/metabase/issues/48846
Just add 1-pixel correction to the `dy` returned by `getBarLabelLayout()`
- Hover bars -> before: data labels slightly change their position, after: not anymore
- [ ] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR
> Okay, so tests are failing because some are still asserting the old data picker. I'll just modify them enough to pass for now.
This PR connects the Simple data picker UI to the data (search models + tables).
See the [slack discussion](https://metaboat.slack.com/archives/C063Q3F1HPF/p1738248655057009) for certain decisions in this PR.
The easiest way to test is to mock `isWithinIframe` function
to return `true` then visit http://localhost:3000/question/notebook and go from there.
- [ ] ~Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR~ The tests will be added in the next PRs.

2820919005,pull_request,closed,,Fix - Can't edit field descriptions from the edit mode of ""learn about my data""","Closes #37907

No design for this. I naively added the description input to make it look similar to [the UI in data model page](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5b05f196-ac13-4e7a-88ef-b8298c95dbc6) while preserving existing look and feel of the data reference page (`max-width: 600px` on input container).
It also [adds padding](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f268ca1d-da91-4285-bf44-e2f11ecc0c7a) on the right-hand side of the fields list, to make the horizontal line look sane.
8. You should be able to edit descriptions of all fields - change some
Verify that field description has been updated (e.g. browse the table and hover over column header to see updated descriptions).

column1: When running e2e tests we most likely want to have either the dev or watch command running, we can remove this extra build step adds a minute to the command

column1: - Please note that the whole admin panel hasn't been designed with the smaller screens in mind.
- Provided Figma design also doesn't include screens on how this page should look like on small screens
- The layout I implemented is the ""lowest-effort but still decent"" trade-off
- Once we decide to overhaul the admin panel, this might be solved in a more holistic and ""pixel perfect"" way
- We don't have tests for other upsells (to the best of my knowledge)

- If reviewers think it might be good to add them for this scenario, please LMK",nemanjaglumac,2025-01-30 13:22:31+00:00,['nemanjaglumac'],2025-01-30 17:50:34+00:00,2025-01-30 17:50:31+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/52955,"[('no-backport', 'Do not backport this PR to any branch')]","[{'comment_id': 2624801642, 'issue_id': 2820828867, 'author': 'trunk-io[bot]', 'body': '<!-- Trunk Test Analytics -->

column1: The test was flaking essentially because of a bug in Cypress. the `assertDatasetReqIsSandboxed` helper is using a combination of `cy.get()`Â and `cy.then()` commands. `cy.then()` does not have retryability mechanisms that most of Cypress commands have. This is by design and itâ€™s not necessarily a bug. Usually you would use `.then()` if you want to test something that is already finished doing itâ€™s thing. for example `cy.request().then()`Â makes complete sense, because `.then()`Â will only execute once response comes back.

The problem in this test was that because of the nature of `.then()`Â command, what `cy.get()` would return in the `assertDatasetReqIsSandboxed` helper would be `undefined`. This is no big deal when using `cy.get()` for the common use case such as getting elements on page, because `cy.get()`Â will either retry itself when searching for a DOM element, or is re-called when an assertion or other query command is not satisfied.

in this particular use case, we are trying to `cy.get()` an alias which for some reason is not present at the very first moment of `cy.get()`Â being called. this will pass `undefined` to `.then()` function.
We simply need to substitute `.then()` with a `.should()` command. in case of `cy.get()`Â not having a value, `.should()` will prompt it to try again, until fetching the alias is successful

column1: 2820398828,pull_request,closed,,Last axis label is now there on row charts,Closes #44735

The rowchart contains logic to render only the tick labels that can be fully displayed, i.e. not render the ones that might overflow. Most of the time, this prevents the last tick from being displayed, and it's fine, but in our case the last tick display 100% and the chart looks weird without it.

This PR changes the logic by allowing the last tick to be displayed, and padding the axis accordingly. The padding logic has been modified too, in order to affect the scale's range, and not its domain.
I have also changed the unit test a bit so checkign the ticks is more readable and sturdier.
- [x] Tests have been added/updated to cover changes in this PR

2820343561,pull_request,closed,,[MANTINE] ci: find css variables that are used but never defined,**This PR is best reviewd as commit by commit, as the first 3 commits are cherry picks.**
This cherry-picks https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/52910 on the mantine branch and:
- ~allows all css variables that start with `--mantine-` as they're defined by mantine~ edit: it now parses the mantine css file to read them! ðŸš€
- cherry picks https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/52808 which was merged on master and fixed some variables
- adds all the other variables found by the script on a temporary whitelist, so that we can merge both the script and the mantine branch.
Ideally we'd verify if those variables are really undefined where they're used and fix the whitelist accordingly
The reason this is a separate PR is so that we don't block the mantine branch from getting merged.

The original PR will be backported, while the whitelist should *not* be backported as otherwise the script wouldn't catch when we accidentally backport code that uses mantine css variables",npretto,2025-01-30 09:41:22+00:00,['npretto'],2025-01-30 17:23:44+00:00,2025-01-30 16:03:05+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/52947,"[('.Team/Embedding', '')]","[{'comment_id': 2624074730, 'issue_id': 2820343561, 'author': 'trunk-io[bot]', 'body': '<!-- Trunk Test Analytics -->

column1: 2820272244,pull_request,closed,,Hopefully fix e2e search flakes,1. Clear the in-memory re-indexing queue whenever we load a fresh db snapshot.
2. Wait up to 2s for queue to be drained before performing search.
We almost certainly don't want to slow down search this much in production, so we'll either make that timeout a setting, or put this mechanism behind a non-documented environment variable.
I'm leaning towards the latter for now, to keep things zen.

Other ideas are adding this optional timeout setting to the API itself, or adding another API endpoint dedicated to polling the queue.",crisptrutski,2025-01-30 09:07:45+00:00,['crisptrutski'],2025-01-30 14:24:09+00:00,2025-01-30 13:26:04+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/52944,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/Workflows', 'aka BEC')]","[{'comment_id': 2623991114, 'issue_id': 2820272244, 'author': 'trunk-io[bot]', 'body': '<!-- Trunk Test Analytics -->

2820212206,pull_request,closed,,Disable flaky tests for native editor,Removes the `@flaky` tag for tests that use the native editor, since the move to CodeMirror has made the tests more stable.
That's 12 out of 26 flaky tags, gone!
- [x] [`can save a native question to a dashboard`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/13048573056)
- [x] [`shouldn't remove parts of the query when choosing 'Run selected text' (metabase#16886)`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/13048730502)
- [x] [`should be able to add new columns after hiding some (metabase#15393)`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/13048971123)
- [x] [`autocomplete should complete question slugs inside template tags`](https://github.com/metabase/metabase/actions/runs/13048747573)

column1: 2819813740,pull_request,closed,,Fix Toucan 2 table name for unresolved models,Methodical's multimethods are immutable objects (as opposed to vanilla Clojure multimethods); adding a method works by calling `alter-var-root` and updating the value. Multimethods that self-mutate need to refer back to the underlying var if they want to pick up changes to the multimethod that have happened over the course of the call

column1: This PR combined with https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/52885 will close the above issue, but 52885 is more likely to get merged before this one
Removes the unsafe React lifecycle from the `<DashboardGrid />` component, which was causing console errors:
- Using UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps in strict mode is not recommended and may indicate bugs in your code
It does this by replacing `UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps` with `static getDerivedStateFromProps`, refer to https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/52885 for how that works
- Run the SDK and render a InteractiveDashboard (which should render a DashboardGrid)
- The UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps should still be there, but come from other components (e.g. Table, TableInteractive, Link from react-router 3)
- Add a dummy UNSAFE_componentWillReceiveProps to DashboardGrid.jsx
- The SDK end-to-end test now errors due to unsafe lifecycle being in Visualization

column1: 2819679342,pull_request,closed,,OpenAPI dox generation & request routing overhaul (WAY SHORTER STACKTRACES),- New ""request map"" Ring handlers which are much faster and (IMO) nicer to look at than `compojure/content`
- Makes stacktraces for failed API calls like way way way shorter
- Added full schema for the subset of the OpenAPI spec we target and extra tests
- eliminates the need to put (api/define-routes) in every API namespace, which makes the code a lot nicer to look at

As a side effect of the new routing all API requests are also slightly faster since we send requests right to the relevant handler instead of needing to try a bunch that don't match first. I already did a little work in this direction in https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/52647 which landed earlier today and gives us a ""3x performance boost"" with more efficient custom routing within a namespace -- this PR builds on that and does more efficient routing elsewhere as well. I need to profile this but I would guess we'll shave maybe ~100 Âµs off of each API request versus 52... not huge but that certainly adds up over time.

As part of this project I overhauled the OpenAPI dox generation code to understand the new handlers. The old code took a handler and attempted to reverse the `routes` it was constructed from and build an OpenAPI schema from that... we propagated metadata that recorded the routes all over the place to make this work. My updated code adds a new `handler-with-open-api-spec` type that wraps any Ring handler and adds a function that when called returns its OpenAPI schema. This has way less overhead than passing around metadata since `fn` + `with-meta` has a ton of overhead... [Oleksander pointed out that this has a lot of overhead since the underlying implementation there is not great](https://github.com/camsaul/methodical/pull/150)",camsaul,2025-01-30 01:13:51+00:00,['camsaul'],2025-02-05 17:05:55+00:00,2025-01-30 22:22:09+00:00,https://github.com/metabase/metabase/pull/52935,"[('backport', 'Automatically create PR on current release branch on merge'), ('.Team/DevEx', '')]","[{'comment_id': 2623387333, 'issue_id': 2819679342, 'author': 'trunk-io[bot]', 'body': '<!-- Trunk Test Analytics -->
